newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil sentiment lifts despite lower futures.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil sentiment lifts despite lower futures.

text.p: NWE gas oil was steady to slightly higher on Wednesday with stronger premiums cancelling out the effect of weaker benchmark futures, traders said.

There was talk of buying interest out of France for low sulphur diesel with premiums put at IPE Sept +11/+12 per tonne cif Le Havre. Traders said a cargo had been offered fob Norway at IPE Oct +5.00 per tonne for Sept 1-10 delivery.
Traders saw a steady flow of gas oil out of the Baltic and most valued it around Sept IPE +$1.00/+$1.50 cif Rotterdam although others believed it was worth a dollar more.
Traders said interest in German heating oil picking up.
A 10,000 tonne cargo traded at Sept +3.50, cif Bremen early. Some saw premiums rising later by another 50 cents.
Heating oil barges also showed slightly firmer sentiment with end August liftings valued at IPE Sept +$1.0 per tonne fob ARA. A small barge parcel was sold at 25 cents above that early.
The September IPE contract ended the day 25 cents lower at $188.00 per tonne, but the Sept/Oct barkwardation widened by 75 cents to $2.0.
